definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Her shriek was dulled by the loud crash of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声在震耳的雷声中变得低沉了。

sentences.english: She listened to the deep tone of Xu Huabei's voice.
sentences.chinese: 她听着徐华北低沉的嗓音。

sentences.english: She is always in that gloomy mood.
He had a beautiful deep voice, and played an instrument called a banjo.
sentences.chinese: 他有着一副低沉动听的嗓音，还会弹奏班卓琴。

sentences.english: Some animals' voices are high-pitched, others are low.
sentences.chinese: 一些动物的叫声很尖锐，别的很低沉。

sentences.english: It began as a deep rumble, shattering the predawn silence.
sentences.chinese: 一声低沉的隆隆声，打破了黎明前的寂静。

sentences.english: It was the low thunder of the surf on the shore.
sentences.chinese: 这是拍岸浪发出的低沉的轰鸣声。

sentences.english: Then I heard a voice droning away in the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 接着，我听见大厅中一个低沉的声音在读着什么。

sentences.english: I was very low-spirited, but father and mother encouraged me a lot.
sentences.chinese: 我非常低沉，可爸爸妈妈给我很大勉励。

sentences.english: A few minutes later they heard a long low whistle.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他们听见一阵冗长而低沉的口哨声。

sentences.english: The dog stared at me and gave a low growl .
sentences.chinese: 这只狗紧盯着我，而且发出低沉的吼叫声。

sentences.english: His spirits fell at the sad news.
sentences.chinese: 惨的消息，他的情绪低沉下来。

sentences.english: "The citizeness is superb! " croaked the Juryman.
sentences.chinese: “优秀的女公民，”陪审员低沉着嗓子说。

sentences.english: From the telescreen a brassy female voice was squalling a patriotic song.
sentences.chinese: 电幕上一个低沉的女人声音在唱一支爱国歌曲。

sentences.english: The Blue Man paused. His voice dropped.
sentences.chinese: 蓝皮人又顿了一下，声音低沉下来。

definition: high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
